newsitem.title: USA: US E. Coast heating oil stocks up 500,000 bbl- EIA.
newsitem.headline: US E. Coast heating oil stocks up 500,000 bbl- EIA.

text.p: U.S. East Coast heating oil stocks grew by 500,000 barrels to 23.8 million barrels in the week ending September 27, the Energy Information Administration said Wednesday.

However the gain was too little to offset losses in other regions, which pushed total U.S. heating oil stocks down 400,000 barrels to 48.7 million barrels, 29 percent less than a year ago, according to data from EIA.
"Low heating oil stocks continue as an issue of concern as September ends and the traditional heating season begins," EIA said in its weekly distillate watch.
East Coast distillate stocks, which include heating oil and diesel, gained 400,000 barrels to reach 38.4 million barrels last week from the previous week.
Total U.S. distillate stocks fell 800,000 bbls to 111.0 million barrels, including a 400,000 barrel drop in diesel inventories.
"Total distillate production was a strong 3.4 million barrels per day, but heating oil output declined, especially in PADD I (East Coast)," EIA said.
Imports averaged 234,000 bpd last week, their highest level since the beginning of August.
Distillate demand rose to 3.6 million bpd last week from 3.4 million bpd the previous week.
